message.content: This question requires knowledge of the force of gravity and its effects on planets. The pull of gravity on a planet is caused by its mass, which is measured in kilograms. Option (A) is incorrect because people do not cause the pull of gravity on a planet. Option (B) is also incorrect because plants do not have enough mass to significantly affect the pull of gravity. Option (D) is incorrect because air does not have enough mass to cause the pull of gravity on a planet.

This question asks for the cause of gravity on a planet, which requires basic knowledge of the concept of gravity. The pull of gravity on a planet is caused by mass. Mass is a measure of the amount of matter an object contains, and it is typically measured in kilograms. Therefore, option (C) is the correct answer. Options (A), (B), and (D) are incorrect because they do not have an effect on the pull of gravity on a planet.
